You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 464, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 480, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 363, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 325, 545]]<|/det|> - You may use a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 542, 579, 559]]<|/det|> - You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 558, 672, 575]]<|/det|> - Take the weight of 1.0 kg to be 9.8 N (acceleration of free fall \(=9.8 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}\) ). <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 214, 616]]<|/det|> INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 620, 388, 635]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 636, 730, 652]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ] .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 74, 648, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[496, 256, 587, 273]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 287, 856, 305]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 318, 881, 336]]<|/det|>

2 (a) A resultant force is applied to an object moving with a velocity \(v\) in a straight line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 105, 825, 122]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[189, 135, 213, 153]]<|/det|>
1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[189, 166, 213, 182]]<|/det|>
2

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 275, 918, 292]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 581, 339]]<|/det|>

3 Fig. 3.1 shows a side view of part of a concrete track at a skateboard park.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 102, 667, 181]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[466, 197, 532, 213]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 226, 918, 244]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 273, 918, 290]]<|/det|>
Describe the transfer of energy as the skateboarder travels from A to B to C along the concrete track.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 412, 918, 429]]<|/det|>
(b) (i) B is at ground level and C is at 2.8 m above ground level. The mass of the skateboarder is 65 kg .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 459, 791, 475]]<|/det|>
Calculate the work done on the skateboarder as she travels from B to C .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[477, 577, 584, 592]]<|/det|>
work done =

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 605, 918, 622]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 652, 918, 668]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 74, 562, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 570, 122]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 136, 223, 151]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 259, 472, 276]]<|/det|>
